Detailed Description

) [static] 

00130                                                                                                       {
00131         List<Pixel> result = new ArrayList<Pixel>();
00132         // we want to find the intersection at all the lat of the grid
00133         double[] lat2 = new double[grid.getNumLat()];
00134         for (int i=0; i < lat2.length; ++i){
00135             lat2[i] = grid.getLocation(i, 0).getLat(); // lat of row
00136         }
00137         double[] lon2 = sort_and_interpolate(controllat, controllon, lat2);
00138         for (int i=0; i < lon2.length; ++i){
00139             int col = grid.getCol(new LatLon(lat2[i],lon2[i])); // col to fill in
00140             result.add(new Pixel(i,col,grid.getValue(i,col)));
00141         }
00142         return result;
00143     }

static double [] edu.ou.asgbook.rasterization.CatmullRom.interpolate ( double[]  x1,
double[]  y1,
double[]  x2 
) [static]

Determines the y coordinates for the given x2 by interpolating the spline control points (x1,y1).

The control points need to be sorted in x. 

00033                                                                              {
00034         // result: initialize at lower-bound value
00035         if ( x1.length == 0 ) return new double[x2.length];
00036         double[] y2 = new double[x2.length];
00037         for (int i=0; i < y2.length; ++i){
00038             y2[i] = y1[0];
00039         }
00040 
00041         // every interval is p1 <= p2 <= p3 where p2 is resampling position
00042         double p3 = x2[0] - 1; // below first value
00043         for (int i=0; i < x2.length; ++i){
00044             // find interval which contains p2
00045             double p2 = x2[i];
00046             if ( p2 <= x1[0]     ){ y2[i] = y1[0]; continue; }
00047             if ( p2 >= back(x1) ){ y2[i] = back(y1); continue; }
00048             int j = 0;
00049             while (j < (int)x1.length && p2 > x1[j]){ ++j; }
00050             --j; //if ( p2 < x1[j] ) --j;
00051 
00052             double p1 = x1[j];
00053             p3 = x1[j+1];
00054 
00055             // j and j+1 will be in bounds but j-1 and j+2 may not be
00056             int j1 = j-1; if (j1 < 0) j1 = 0;
00057             int j2 = j+2; if (j2 > (x1.length-1)) j2 = x1.length-1;
00058 
00059             // spline
00060             double dx  = 1.0f / (p3 - p1);
00061             double dx1 = 1.0f / (p3 - x1[j1]);
00062             double dx2 = 1.0f / (x1[j2] - p1);
00063             double dy  = (y1[j+1] - y1[j]) * dx;
00064             double yd1 = (y1[j+1] - y1[j1]) * dx1;
00065             double yd2 = (y1[j2] - y1[j]) * dx2;
00066             double a0y =  y1[j];
00067             double a1y =  yd1;
00068             double a2y =  dx *  ( 3*dy - 2*yd1 - yd2);
00069             double a3y =  dx*dx*(-2*dy +   yd1 + yd2);
00070 
00071             // cubic polynomial
00072             double x = p2 - p1;
00073             y2[i] = ((a3y*x + a2y)*x + a1y)*x + a0y;
00074         }
00075         return y2;
00076     }

static double [] edu.ou.asgbook.rasterization.CatmullRom.sort_and_interpolate ( double[]  x1,
double[]  y1,
double[]  x2 
) [static] 

00090                                                                                       {
00091 
00092         int N = x1.length;
00093 
00094         // create structure for sorting
00095         XtoY[] data = new XtoY[N];
00096         for (int i=0; i < N; ++i){
00097             data[i] = new XtoY();
00098             data[i].orig_index = i;
00099             data[i].scaledx = (int)Math.round(x1[i] * 1000 + 0.5);
00100             data[i].scaledy = (int)Math.round(y1[i] * 1000 + 0.5);
00101         }
00102         Arrays.sort(data);
00103 
00104         // create input data
00105         double[] x= new double[N];
00106         double[] y= new double[N];
00107         int curr = 0;
00108         for (int i=0; i < N; ++i){
00109             // if you have two or more y values for same x, then use avg
00110             int start_i = i;
00111             while ( (i+1) < N && data[i].scaledx == data[i+1].scaledx ){
00112                 ++i;
00113             }
00114             x[curr] = x1[data[i].orig_index];
00115             double sumy = 0;
00116             for (int k=start_i; k <= i; ++k){
00117                 sumy += y1[data[k].orig_index];
00118             }
00119             y[curr] = sumy/(i-start_i+1);
00120             ++curr;
00121         }
00122 
00123         x = Arrays.copyOf(x, curr);
00124         y = Arrays.copyOf(y, curr);
00125 
00126         // call interpolate
00127         return interpolate( x, y, x2 );
00128     }
